markdownRemark.html:
NOTE: Calendar entry is now changed to hold this meeting weekly; last week we forgot to hold the meeting because we hadn’t changed the calendar invite.

Attendees

  • Karsten Wade @quaid

Agenda and Notes:

  1. Finish updating project board DONE

  2. Longer existing items

    1. Centralizing SIG Community as the main meeting to get Op1st things done and talked about
    2. Removing the stale/rotten watch by Sesheta on the SIG Community project board (to enable long-running tickets)
    3. Regular status updates or awareness of Open Source projects running on the community cloud Open ops dev environments.
    4. Github discussion boards (https://docs.github.com/en/discussions) as a part of our communication to the community?

  3. Current important topics

    1. Meeting is now weekly

      • ACTION @quaid change invite
      • ACTION @quaid notify mailing list - https://github.com/operate-first/community/issues/235
    2. SCALE 20x discussion going - https://github.com/operate-first/community/issues/236

    3. Refocusing the Op1st lens - https://github.com/operate-first/community/issues/237

      1. What are the tough questions to answer first?
      2. “Back to the lab”

      3. What does it really mean to be a community of practice?

        1. E.g. Can we work with Ansible and Project Wisdom to create a library of draft playbooks for a CoP to peer review?
    4. SIG-SRE plan - https://github.com/operate-first/community/issues/238
    5. Status of all projects
    6. Working with Janus-idp - https://github.com/operate-first/community/issues/240
    7. How many steps ahead can you “know” for Open? Discussions lead to agreements, agreements keep us going between affinity and alignment - https://github.com/operate-first/community/issues/241
